==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=木04}}

# a [[wooden]] [[shake]] {{gloss|as used in roofing}}
# a [[pine]] tree {{qualifier|rare}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[ぶん]] (bun)
|kanon=[[ふん]] (fun)
|kun=[[そぎ]] (sogi), [[まつ]] (matsu)
|nanori=[[すぎ]] (sugi), [[へぎ]] (hegi)
}}

{{wikipedia|lang=ja|こけら葺}}
[[File:Wooden shingles Sweden.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|枌}}: ''sogi'' on a roof]]
{{wikipedia|Shake_(shingle)|Shake (shingle)}}

===Etymology 1===
Abbreviation of {{l|ja|枌板}}, {{l|ja|削板|tr=''sogiita''}}, itself a compound of {{m|ja|削ぎ|tr=sogi||shaving, chipping|pos=stem noun form of verb {{l|ja|削ぐ|tr=sogu}}, “to chip or shave off”}} + {{m|ja|板|tr=ita||board, plank}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[so̞ɡi]|[so̞ŋi]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|削}}, {{l|ja|削ぎ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|そぎ|hhira=そき}}

# a [[wooden]] [[shake#Noun|shake]] or large [[shingle]]: a thin [[board]] or [[plank]] of wood chipped or shaved off a larger piece and used as [[roofing]] or [[siding]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{l|ja|削ぎ板}}, {{l|ja|削板}}, {{l|ja|殺ぎ板}}, {{l|ja|殺板}}, {{l|ja|枌板|tr={{l|ja|そぎいた}}, ''{{l|ja|sc=Latn|sogiita}}''; {{l|ja|そぎた}}, ''{{l|ja|sc=Latn|sogita}}''}}

=====Related terms=====
* {{l|ja|杮|tr={{l|ja|こけら}}, ''{{l|ja|sc=Latn|kokera}}''}}: wood chips; a [[shingle]] (smaller than a ''sogi'')
* {{l|ja|杮葺|tr={{l|ja|こけらぶき}}, ''{{l|ja|sc=Latn|kokerabuki}}''}}: [[shingling]]; a [[shingled]] [[roof]]

===Etymology 2===
Uncommon alternate spelling for {{m|ja|松|tr=matsu||pine tree}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ma̠t͡sɯᵝ]|[ma̠t͡sɯ̥ᵝ]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|まつ}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|松|dot=:}} {{lb|ja|rare|sort=まつ}} a [[pine]] tree

=====Usage notes=====
Seldom used. The spelling {{l|ja|松}} is much more common.
